#Text=Willem van den
#Text=Blocke
#Text=The High Gate in Danzig – Status before the removal of the walls ( drawing by Julius Greth , 1855 )
#Text=Willem van den
#Text=Blocke

#Text=( alternative names : Willem van den Block , Willem van den Bloocke , Wilhelm von dem Block , Wilhelm von dem Blocke , Wilhem van Block ) ( c. 1550 – 1628 ) was a sculptor and architect of Flemish descent who was active in the Baltics and worked in a mannerist style .
#Text=Biography
#Text=He was born in Mechelen , the son of Franciscus van den Blocke who was a sculptor . [ 1 ]
#Text=Willem received his first training in the art of stone carving and sculpting in his father 's workshop in Mechelen . [ 2 ]
#Text=He then likely moved for further training to the workshop of Cornelis Floris de Vriendt in Antwerp . [ 3 ]
#Text=In 1569 he went to Königsberg ( Kaliningrad ) .

#Text=He was part of a group of pupils and assistants of Cornelis Floris , which included Gert van Egen , Robert Coppens and Philips Brandin , who moved to the Baltic region to take advantage of Floris ’ network and the international popularity of the Floris style .
#Text=The Baltic region was at the time politically relatively stable when compared to Willem 's native home , the Spanish Netherlands , which were rife with religious persecution . [ 4 ]
#Text=The van Block family were Mennonites and were particularly vulnerable to such persecution in their home country . [ 2 ]
#Text=In the Baltics there was also less competition from other artists . [ 4 ]
#Text=In Konigsberg van den Blocke worked on the monumental tomb of Albert , Duke in Prussia , designed by Floris , in the local cathedral .
#Text=In 1581 he designed and executed the tomb of princess Elizabeth , the first wife of George Frederick , Margrave of Brandenburg-Ansbach , also in the Königsberg Cathedral . [ 5 ]
#Text=Uppsala Cathedral , tomb of King John III of Sweden .
#Text=After 14 years of service to the Margrave , he received a recommendation letter and then went to work in Poland .
#Text=He received many commissions such as the design and execution of the tomb of Christopher Báthory , brother of the King of Poland Stephen Báthory . [ 5 ]
#Text=He completed this commission from 1581 to 1583 in Wartenburg ( Barczewo ) . [ 1 ]
#Text=In early 1584 he went to Gyulafehérvár in Transylvania to install in the local church a tomb he had created .
#Text=Willem van den Blocke moved on 18 June 1584 to Danzig ( Gdańsk ) , the center of the Vistula delta Mennonites , carrying with him a recommendation by Stephen Báthory , the king of Poland .
#Text=As he was in royal employ , he did not have to join the local guild .
#Text=He ran a workshop in Danzig until his death [ 5 ]
#Text=His most important work in Danzig was the design of one of the gates in the city walls , called the High Gate ( completed in 1588 ) .
#Text=He also created numerous epitaphs and tombs .
#Text=He also designed the facades of town houses in Danzig , Toruń ( Thorn ) and Elbing ( Elbląg ) . [ 1 ]
#Text=His son Abraham van den Blocke was also an architect and sculptor , [ 6 ] whereas his sons Jacob van den Blocke , Isaak van den Blocke and David van den Blocke were painters . [ 1 ] Van den
#Text=Blocke died in Danzig in the same year as his sons Abraham and Isaac , likely from an infectious disease .
#Text=Work
#Text=Willem van den
#Text=Brocke is regarded as the main representative in the Baltics of Italianizing Flemish mannerism as developed first by Cornelis Floris .
#Text=Although he designed many building ornaments , he is best known for his monuments .
#Text=His monuments are characterized by their clarity and rich ornamentation .
#Text=The deceased are presented realistically . [ 5 ]
#Text=Works
#Text=Epitaph of Edward Blemke in the St. Mary 's Church , 1591
#Text=Tomb of the King John III of Sweden in Uppsala Cathedral ( 1593 – 1596 ) , was until 1782 installed in the Great Armoury in Danzig , and re-assembled at the current location in 1817 – 1818
#Text=Tomb of Ture Nilsson Bjelke and his wife Margaret Svantesdotter Sture in the Linköping Cathedral , c. 1615
#Text=Attributed Works ( selection )
#Text=Mannerist crown most probably created for Stephen Báthory in Gdańsk after Willem van den Blocke] 's design in about 1584 [ 7 ]
#Text=Epitaphs
#Text=Brandes family in the St. Mary 's Church , Danzig , 1588
#Text=Christoph von Dohna in St. Canute 's Cathedral in Odense in Denmark , 1586
#Text=Valentin Bodecker in the St. Nicholas Church in Elbing , 1587

#Text=Kos family in Oliwa Cathedral , 1600 or 1620
#Text=Martin de Berzewice in Lisnowo near Brodnica , 1592 ( destroyed 1939 )
#Text=Andreas and Balthasar Báthory in the St. Andrew 's Church in Wartenburg , 1598
#Text=Peter Tarnowski in the cathedral of Łowicz , after 1604
#Text=Stanislaus Radziwill in the former Bernardine church in Vilnius , 1618 – 1623
